text: 3. Residual adenoid hypertrophy and recurrent epistaxis.
context: 3. Residual adenoid hypertrophy and recurrent epistaxis.

text: 3. Residual adenoid hypertrophy and recurrent epistaxis.
context: 3. Residual adenoid hypertrophy and recurrent epistaxis.
Endotracheal intubation carried out by Dr. X
Afrin was instilled in both sides of the nose and allowed to take effect for a period of time.
The hypertrophic tonsils were then removed by the suction and snare.
Bleeding was minimal and controlled with packing followed by electrocautery followed by extensive additional irrigation.
.An inspection of the nasopharynx confirmed that the adenoids were in fact hypertrophic rubbery cryptic and obstructive.
They were shaved back, flushed with prevertebral fascia with curette.

A nasal endoscope was used to identify the plexus of bleeding, which was predominantly on the left mid portion of the septum that was controlled with broad superficial cauterization using a suction cautery device
n additional control was established by infiltrating slowly with a 1% Xylocaine with epinephrine around the perimeter of the bleeding site and then cauterizing the bleeding site itself.
The oropharynx was reinspected, clots removed, the patient was extubated, taken to the recovery room in stable condition.
